page.title: 04SOLENT COASTGUARD IN W WIGHT
page.content:
The Solent coastguard station is on the most western point of the Isle of Wight overlooking the Needles Rock and lighthouse.The coastguard lookout is open 365 days of the year and 24 Hours a day.It has been manned since the 1950's.It is a very important part of the search and rescue organisation and is the busiest coastguard station in the country.The coastguard lookout deals with all the rescues of ships and yachts that get into trouble between Bournemouth pier and Pagham harbour at Selsey as well as cliff rescue and beach patrol locally.
Nicholas Gibbs 9 years
